name: viva-connections-toolkit
description: SharePoint Framework Toolkit aims to boost your productivity in developing and managing SharePoint Framework solutions helping at every stage of your development flow, from setting up your development workspace to deploying a solution straight to your tenant without the need to leave VS Code and now even create a CI/CD pipeline to introduce automate deployment of your app. This toolkit is provided by the community.

walkthroughs.title: SharePoint Framework Toolkit Introduction
walkthroughs.description: Start your journey wih SharePoint Framework and learn how to boost your productivity in developing and managing SharePoint Framework solutions.

steps.title: Introduction to SharePoint Framework
steps.description:
Learn SharePoint Framework and set up your Microsoft 365 tenant 
[Join the Microsoft 365 Developer Program](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/dev-program)

steps.title: Validate your local workspace
steps.description:
Validate if your local workspace is ready for SharePoint Framework development by checking and installing the required dependencies. 
[Check dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.checkDependencies)

steps.title: Create new project
steps.description:
Use the scaffolding form to create a new project or use one of the existing samples to kick off a new project and boost your development.
[Create a new project](command:spfx-toolkit.createProject)
[View samples](command:spfx-toolkit.samplesGallery)

steps.title: Sign in to Microsoft 365
steps.description:
Retrieve tenant helpful information and Manage your SPFx projects. 
Sign in to your tenant to get started. 
[Sign in to Microsoft 365](command:spfx-toolkit.login)

steps.title: Gulp tasks
steps.description: Get to know the Gulp tasks that are available in your SharePoint Framework project

steps.title: Boost your development with actions
steps.description:
Reduce the amount of context switching and automate your work with Actions. 
Validate your project, rename your solution, deploy it to any app catalog, grant API permissions ... and many more all without leaving the context of your work.

steps.title: Write code faster with coding snippets
steps.description: Write more with less using coding snippets

steps.title: Create a CI/CD workflow for your SPFx project
steps.description:
Create a GitHub Workflow or Azure DevOps pipeline to bundle, package, and deploy your SharePoint Framework project to any App Catalog. 
[Generate CI/CD workflow](command:spfx-toolkit.pipeline)

steps.title: Continue your learning and get additional tooling
steps.description: SharePoint Framework Toolkit is your single point to get to the official Microsoft documentation and learning regarding SharePoint Framework and additional tooling that will help you create apps for Microsoft 365.

steps.title: Connect with the Microsoft 365 and Power Platform community
steps.description:
Stay up to date and connected. 
Visit the [Microsoft 365 and Power Platform community](https://pnp.github.io/) to get more learning materials, guidance, tooling, and engage in community calls. 
Join the [community Discord server](https://aka.ms/community/discord) to stay connected and help out others. 
 Sharing is caring!

viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to SharePoint Framework Toolkit


To start create a new SharePoint Framework project. 
[Create a new project](command:spfx-toolkit.createProject)





Use a sample to kick off a new project and boost your development.
[View samples](command:spfx-toolkit.samplesGallery)





You can also open an existing app.
[Open folder](command:vscode.openFolder)





Validate your local workspace and check if you have the required dependencies.
[Check dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.checkDependencies)





Install the required dependencies.
[Install dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.installDependencies)



Learn more about SharePoint Framework and this toolkit.
[Walkthrough](command:spfx-toolkit.welcome)



For additional help or resources visit the [extension wiki](https://github.com/pnp/vscode-viva/wiki).
